Reviews.Title: “Cheap cheap cheap; location location location”
Reviews.Author: pooyousir
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights ago for one night. I think we paid Â£80-85 for our room. Location is really excellent - very central, being in the San Marco section of Venice. Room was much better than we expected. Very nice comfy bed in a smallish room (but fine for us backpackers). Room was nicely decorated with a thick shag brown carpet and high ceiling. Bathroom was fine though shower cubicle was very small (and I'm not a fatty). Breakfast was remarkable for the bad as well as the good. I don't recall ever having such vile coffee, but the small croissants were unlimited (I limited myself to 5), and there was a nice selection of yoghurts (I had two) and some fairly cheapish cheese and ham (I also had some of this). The orange juice I could have sworn had been watered down. Such a large breakfast meant not having to stop for a â‚¬20 snack prior to lunch - well worth keeping in mind if you find the prices (more expensive than Zurich or Lichtenstein) somewhat heart-stopping. I could hear someone snoring from another room, which was quite bizarre, as aside from that I heard no other noises. Staff were very Italian and very friendly, though one of the receptionists (there were two when we walked in) had a black eye. I asked if they'd had a falling out. He said 'no'. One other point - given that every time I stay in a hotel I see a number of guests (including us too usually) wanting to leave their bags prior to check-in or after check-out, I find it incredible that most hotels (including this one) have such an insecure service for this. Yes, they had room for bags to be left, but the total lack of any security for them would have left me quite nervous had I had anything of any value left behind (eg Murano glassware - btw, Murano's even better than Venice). And another security point - why did we have to leave our keys with the reception every time we went out if all we had to do was say our room number in order to have our keys returned to us? What sort of security is this? At least ask for the name under which our room is booked. Regardless, I'm still giving a score of 5 owing to the location, price and fact that the hotel is actually rather nice.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AliS82
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of a battle finding the place, but I think that was more a case of the language barrier, fatigue and not preparing properly. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Unfortunately there isn't a lift, but fortunately we were on the 2nd floor. The room was nice and spacious with very comfortable furniture and sound proof compared to other places we had stayed in Italy. The breakfast buffet was great value for money and the best we had in its class. It is very close walking distance to San Marco square which was awesome for us. But best of all, we had great quality sleep. I would advise that you plan your route before hand as it is difficult to find your way around Venice. All round good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value especially for solo travelers..”
Reviews.Author: emz_hatake
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect that the room would look just like they do in the pictures. There were easy to follow directions on the website from the Rialto traghetto stop so I didn't have a hard time finding it. The room was clean and well furnished. I really like the tall ceilings. Breakfast was good too. If you have a heavy luggage, you would have to be strong enough to carry it to your room because there are no elevators. The receptionist was the only worker present so they really won't or can't help you with your luggage. I'm glad I only had one flight of stairs to climb. The area is nice at night. It's usually blah during the day but it's really nice with the lights on either direction at night when it comes alive. You can walk to anywhere. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JA_1981
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centauro is located just right, 10 min walk to Piazza San Marco, Peggy Guggenhiem 2 mins from the Rialto Bridge and Accademia. Very central!!! Overlooking the canal where you can hear the gondoliers singing. Things to note are that it is closer and simpler to get to from the Rialto vaporetto stop. We made the mistake of getting off at Zattere and took an hour to reach the hotel as we got lost in the alleyways. We had the deluxe room, which was large and beautifully done. The bathroom was small, but that is true for anywhere you go in Italy:) But it served the purpose. We paid 120 euros a night in the peak season i.e. July,2011. Breakfast was included. Breakfast was rather nice with cold cuts eggs to order the works. It was not like an American buffet, but served a lot more than regular continental breakfast served at hotels generally all over Italy. The breakfast room was also quite nice overlooking the canal. The negatives - We reached there around 9:30-10am, and has requested for an early check in but once there they refused to let us check in till 2pm. They promised us a canal facing room but did not give us one. The staff was not helpful. They spoke some English but did not seem willing to help with anything. (directions, food recommendations etc.) Fortunately they let us leave our luggage at the hotel till 2pm. We were in Venice only for a night and decided we did not want to ruin our moods as the hotel itself was nice. Would definitely recommend it . But the staff at the reception really needs to be little more customer service oriented. In fact we saw this in all the hotels we stayed in Italy - Rome, Naples, Venice - customer service is really missing at the reception. They are just not bothered. But Venice itself is soo gorgeous that it helps you forget all the negatives. Its a city to get lost in. You just cannot not feel the romance when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Centauro is a great value hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AGuyFromHawaii
Reviews.Content: Second time I stayed there and still a great place to be in Venice. Very close (but not in) the crazy part of the tourist packed center of San Marco. Located about 200 yards from the Rialto Bridge on a little alley off Campo Manin, the hotel has great staff, wonderful breakfast area, and good rooms. Be advised though that there aren't any elevators. I would definitely stay there again when traveling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: samuel p
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed here over the weekend and the people were very friendly and helpful. the location is perfect, the breakfast was great and the breakfast room overlooks a canal, it's like going to a restaurant in the morning, the rooms are small but very beautiful and very comfortable. they also let us leave our luggage there after check out on our last day. we had a great experience, would definitely book here on our next vacation. the only thing is, you should print a map from home before you get to venice or you might have a hard time finding the hotel as street signs are not very regular, there were some missing on our way to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: Psychobabbl
Reviews.Content: We had heard what an expensive town Venice is to stay in, and had considered staying across the canal because of the cost being cheaper. However, we only had parts of 2 days and one night to stay, so we wanted to be close to San Marco square. I honestly expected to be staying in a hotel that was a little run-down as many can be in Europe. Imagine our delight when we opened the door (which is decorated in the style of Mozart's day - charmingly baroque), and found a delightful room with brocade fabric on the walls, the bedspread and curtains. A modern bath that even had a towel warmer (where can I get one of those??). The staff was extremely helpful, giving patient directions to lost travellers! San Marco is a five minute walk, as is the Rialto Bridge shopping area. Location couldn't be much better, although our room windows opened onto the alley off the front door - so we had no view. The breakfast room has a balcony onto a side canal, and the breakfast was surprisingly good - eggs, ham, cheese, fruit, yogurt, danish, toast, croissants, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. We are in our early 60s, and will return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Value,Tiny shower”
Reviews.Author: rusb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on the 3rd floor. As others have mentioned the stairs are interesting, 62 steep stairs to carry your luggage up. The room is on the small side but clean and comfortable what you should expect in a Venice hotel room. The shower is extremely small, if you drop the soap you have to get out of the shower to pick it up. I would not want to be a large person trying to use the shower. The breakfast was great, ask for a cappuccino. The staff were very helpful. The location was very good and central between St Marks square and Rialto bridge, but as others have said study the location use the lion statue to help guide you back to the hotel. We got lost many times but that is part of the Venice experience. I would stay here again but not for a long stay, it is great for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Typically venetian !”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Sokat
Reviews.Content: I was going to Venezia with my boyfriend for a night and a day. We had little time to visit, and this hotel is right close to the plaza San Marco so it was perfect. We could go and see everything by walking not too long. Rialto bridge, san marco plaza and basilica, sopiri bridge, etc.. i did book it via Venere and it was a deal so we got this big room with terrace for 179EUR, which is a good price for this kind of hotel in Venice ! I was expecting a view on the canal though as the website was saying all the rooms in the last floor would have the view on it but we didnot. Anyway, we were staying only one night so it was allright. The rooms are typically venetian, considering the furnitures, and the bedding, so it was what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cubanjunky
Reviews.Content: I was suprised how easy i found the Hotel, mind you i did the virtual tour a few times Everybody in the Hotel was very friendly and helpfull.My single room was small with high walls and the window just looking at the wall across. But i wasnt in Venice to stay in the room, I only slept in the bed. There was no english channel on the TV but i just listened to the music-channel and read in the evening. The Hotel was very quiet. Breakfast was in a lovely room with view on a Canal. I would recommend this Hotel as the location is fantastic.I was there for 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good experience”
Reviews.Author: agal15
Reviews.Content: Very good location, with Gondolieri singing arias in the nearby canal. We were a family of four, and reserved a single room for four. The room was huge. It's an historic building and room, but bath was modern. Compared to hotels around the globe - well overpriced (but so is all of Venice). Nice breakfast. Bottom line - very nice Venice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But...”
Reviews.Author: Sally O
Reviews.Content: Ok, I know its a cliche but this hotel was not bad for Venice however, there has surely got to be better value than this. Maybe there isn't unless you pay a great deal more but I am not convinced. Well located, tiny rooms, thin walls, hard bed and canal views that reminded me of the drains at home. Hmm... My advice is to keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and historic stairs...”
Reviews.Author: turistomerIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Centauro for 2 nights and enjoyed it very much. We arrived by train and with Allelaguna Blue Line we arrived to San Marco and followed hotelâ€™s address directions given on itâ€™s web and we found it easily.Althought on the following days we lost our way to hotel few times but that was a good opportunity to see the environment and canals once again. Room and bathroom are clean, we stayed at the 3rd floor, there were many steps but we didnâ€™t bother, hence to see mark on the floor dated 1904 is another fun. Breakfast was included to room price which was nice. With nice selections.There is no free wifi and reception welcoming is good.I checked from the web and found out that this is the best hotel within this price range in the centre of Venice, when we arrived we realised that our selection was correct.Venice has many good restaurants and very nice cafes , you can easily find any of them near and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverinc13
Reviews.Content: I loved the furnishings of this place, it created a really great vibe of old world Venice while still providing desired comforts (private baths, nice breakfast spread). It is in a great central location, at least once you figure out exactly where that location is! I learned to turn left at the Gucci store, and then you'll make it to the square that it is off of. I would stay here again if I return to Venice because it trule was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Traditional venetian hotel with canal view”
Reviews.Author: MeerkatBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Centauro for 2 nights during our honeymoon and would recommend it. Our room had a living space as well as bedroom and we had opted for a canal view which was deifnitely worth it!!! We arrived by train so hopped on the river bus following the hotel's directions and found the hotel easily. It is close to all sights so a great location and very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mikeinstanton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst exploring Venice and whilst it could be a little hard to find the directions in another review took us straight to it. It is charming and the owner was very helpful as well as recommending a great little restaurant. The location is perfect for exploring Venice as you are in short walking distance of both The Rialto Bridge and St Marks's Sq. There is not a lift and the room I stayed in was not overly large but this is very common in Italy and really to be expected. For the price it was very good value and will certainly stay there again next time I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel, alright location, horribly uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: marcnmeg
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very pretty but also would have been hard to find without a lot of help. Love the boutique hotel style, high ceilings and old world feel. We only stayed one night because we were cruising out of the port the next day. I'm glad we only stayed one night because I woke up with the twin "mattresses" pushed to either side and sleeping on the very hard platform underneath. The shower was actually smaller than the one in our cruise room. Breakfast was included which was nice, but every table was dirty when we walked in and only one poor woman trying to run the whole show.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous C
Reviews.Content: +Great traditional hotel. I stayed at 2nd floor, no view and no lift. A/C worked. Breakfast room was very good and provide limited hot food. Staff were all friendly and helpfull if asked. Although hotel location is good for shopping, Rialto Bridge and San Marco. - But i also wasted my time to find this hotel over 1 hour..... as i drop down from San Marco station, it quite difficult to find hotel from this station. If hotel information can provide clear road route in their front page it could be better. Actually, this hotel is closed to Rialto station... we only took around 10 min to hotel, if from San Marco station, we also took 15-20 min to go there

Reviews.Title: “great location, palace like, easy to locate”
Reviews.Author: jonsilverfacebook
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with character, with tv a/c good bathroom and bed. Medieval ambience like a palace. No wifi. In venice be sure to get on the escalator to the top of Campanile di San Marco for amazing views. Check out the Ponte Rialto. Venice can be seen in 2 days easily. Take a night stroll through piazza san marco and along the waterfront. Be sure to declare your love on ponte delle sospire. Al Bacco Felice an amazing pizzeria, trattoria, in via s. croce, A lovely restaurant with ambience and not touristy and not overwhelming with amazing primi piatti, good wine, pasta and original pizzas. The owner Marcello very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently good”
Reviews.Author: spoongirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute gem. I've stayed here three times now (gets easier to find with each visit!) and always find it excellent value for location and service. It's perfectly placed for sight-seeing and an easy distance to both St Marks and Rialto but without the scrum of tourists outside the door. And having a little roof terrace is always a luxury.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for Venice”
Reviews.Author: jibble
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centauro is in an excellent location, between San Marco and Rialto Bridge. The hotel itself is clean and charming, the management helpful and the breakfast very good. Be sure to pack light when traveling to Italy, especially Venice. There are no elevators and when rooms are on the third floor, it's like dragging luggage up six floors. You go up a flight of stairs to a landing and then another flight to the second floor and repeat the process again to the third floor. Whew! It's easier to reach the hotel from the Rialto Bridge than San Marco. It's closer and you avoid many up and down stairs and crossing over bridges. We were very happy with the hotel and would stay there again. We spent 3 nights there the end of May, 2011. jibble

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Room just OK”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Abq
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was a little tricky to find, but really well located and not far whether we wanted to walk or take the Vaparetto to our destination. The people were very friendly - from the front desk attendant, to the cleaning crew, to the breakfast coordinators. There is no elevator and we were on the third floor, so walking up and down the narrow uneven stairs with our suitcases was a bit of a challenge. The temperature was quite warm in the common areas too, so we worked up a bit of a sweat getting to the room. The room was just ok. It was clearly dated based on decor and the feel of the bed and linens. There was a step up to get into the bathroom and the bathroom was VERY small. There was no way for two people to be in there at one time. The shower was very cramped as well. We only stayed for one night and that was fine, but I would not have wanted to stay there for several nights in a row. The breakfast was very good, plenty of options and again very friendly staff! They were also very accomodating regarding dropping off our luggage early and leaving it there after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location .....”
Reviews.Author: WOO2702
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights towards the end of March . Although the hotel was a little tricky to find it provided a great base to explore this beautiful city ! A stones through from the Grand Canal , the Rialto Bridge and from the Basillica .Plenty of bars and restaurants nearby . The hotel was basic but clean , showers were hot , staff very helpful and polite and breakfast very adequate with a good choice . Would def stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cyrus01
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to Venice as a birthday present. Thinking the hotel only needs to be somewhere to sleep, I booked a 3 star hotel. All I can say is what an excellent choice, the hotel was beautiful and the staff where very helpful and friendly. The location was great, within easy walking distance of Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge. We were given room 34; it was top floor double room with a terrace, ok so the terrace didnâ€™t have the views but still it was nice to have a bit of privacy and sit out in the sun in the evening. The room its self was more than I would of asked for, the walls were decorated with a beautiful patterned fabric, the bed was very comfortable, there was plenty of space in the wardrobe and the bathroom was well fitted with all you will need. The breakfasts offered a good continental breakfast, in a very ornate breakfast room. But as stated another review the coffee wasnâ€™t great. In all I would stay there again and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and comfortable in the heart of San Marco”
Reviews.Author: USManfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Centauro in Feb 2011. With one teen and one pre-teen, the quadruple room was big enough that we could all maneuver. It is one room, so for those wanting more privacy, would need to book separate rooms or a self catering apartment. Service was first rate and English speaking friendly. The hotel itself is tucked away off the Campo Manin, but one can easily get around to all the sights on San Marco. For us, the easiest way to get there is the water shuttle from the airport to Rialto Bridge. From there it is only a 400 meter walk. We had the breakfast included which is the standard European cold buffet breakfast. (Cheeses, Cold meats, breads, etc). Will definitely stay again and again. Though will get two rooms once the lads are full grown teens.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel hidden in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Serieux-Lloyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Centauro Hotel for 3 nights at the end of February 2010. After reading reviews on trip advisor we were slightly anxious about locating the hotel, however, it was not difficult at all. Once you familiarise yourself with the direction of the Rialto Bridge it is easy to locate the hotel's direction. We did not need to be glued to the map and you know you are in the right place when you spot the Campo Manin statue. The reception staff were very welcoming and helped with any questions we had. We booked the superior double room with canal view and I would recommend paying that little extra to get a room with a view as it made our stay even more magical. The room was very clean and the decor was both traditional and beautiful. The en suite was slightly on the small side, but was clean. We had lovely hot showers throughout our stay. Our room had a safe in the wardrobe which was helpful in keeping our travel documents safe. We were woken up every morning to the lovely smell of croissants and coffee, I would recommend going to breakfast earlier than later though. Luckily when we stayed here the hotel was not busy, however, I can imagine that the breakfast hall would get pretty busy in holiday and festival season. There is lots to do in this breathtaking City, water taxi's are the best way to get around and the Lido is lovely to see even in February! The markets, art gallery, glass blowing, bike riding were just some of the many things we got up to in our short stay. Great stay and cannot wait to return, definitely our new home from home.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouiseS4
Reviews.Content: was amazed at value for this hotel - right in Venice, not on the mainland. Lovely rooms, great breakfast, handy location (once you know where you're going, do get a map first!). Helpful & friendly staff. No problems. Only thing - no lift, hope for a lower level bedroom if you have a heavy bag! Phone ahead, make sure you get instructions about which ferry stop to alight at. Try not to arrive at night, as Venice is confusing in the dark!

Reviews.Title: “Well located!”
Reviews.Author: luvrui
Reviews.Content: Been reading lots of reviews on the hard to find location, fortunately, I was able to locate it within couple minutes away from the Rialto bridge. Like the fact that it is closely located to the st marco plaza, the main attraction. I booked the shared facilities single room, but was lucky enough to be allocated a single ensuite room. Room was furnished with retro looking decors, room was clean. Unlike many BNBs which serve only continental breakfast, they actually serve variety hams and cheese, and do not forget to request for an espresso if the brew coffee is too mild! If there is anything i must complain on, there is no free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value”
Reviews.Author: DickSydney
Reviews.Content: Well located neat the Rialto Bridge. Comfortable rooms if somewhat dated fittings. Helpful staff who gave good advice on nearby restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “single room view”
Reviews.Author: NAJE
Reviews.Content: It is worth noting that single "superior room" do not have a view,except looking into a brick wall

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need to see and do within easy walking distance”
Reviews.Author: Hut3Boy
Reviews.Content: Venice, the 2nd most expensive tourist destination in the world behind New York which makes the Centauro pretty reasonable value. A small but tastefully decorated Venetian style room with OK sized en-suite. Its location on the main Venice island, conveniently between San Marco square and the Rialto Vaporetto (Water taxi) station on the canal, makes everything you need to see and do within easy walking distance of the Centauro. The hotel is down a narrow lane off Campo Manin and not that easy to spot from the square so check it out on Google maps first. Excellent breakfast, no lift, air-con (though no remote in our room- maybe only provided in summer?) but no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Not for anyone with mobility problems!”
Reviews.Author: Hollypooch
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the Centauro for 3 nights at the end of September 2010. The hotel is in an excellent location, central for all sight-seeing and within easy walking distance (with luggage) from the water bus stop (Rialto) on the Grand Canal. Our room which was at the back of the hotel, on the top floor, was quite small but was perfectly adequate and peaceful. Our bathroom was well appointed and we had a reasonably sized balcony. Breakfast was satisfactory with a variety of continental selections, although the coffee was awful. Everywhere was clean and spotless. The hotel has no lift and stairs were a killer after along day sight seeing and especially on arrival with our luggage - although the young man on reception did help (it seemed as a favour) with one of our bags whilst we struggled up 3 flights of stairs together with the other. A porter service for guests checking in & out would definitely be an advantage for this hotel! On the whole good value for money and I could recommend this hotel to anyone who does not have any mobility problems.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Breakfast Make it an okay Choice...otherwise"”
Reviews.Author: globalbetty1
Reviews.Content: The room with a "terrace balcony was barely big enough to stand on - but it did overlook the canal. As it was on the first floor there was some noise from the motorboats early in the morning. All in all, the terrace suite which was badly in need of good lighting seemed somewhat pricey at $205 euros a night. The staff was not friendly and they forgot our wake up call. Still - the location was excellent and the breakfast provided was very good.

Reviews.Title: “good place to go”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMontreal
Reviews.Content: this hotel is clean, friendly, perfectly located and good breakfast. Small hotel in a calm street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jazzer1
Reviews.Content: If you had to stick a pin in a map to mark the centre of Venice, it would probably be pretty close to this hotel. The hotel is itself hidden down a very small alley, and fronts one of the canals on one side - and this is the side its best to have one of the superior rooms. Our room - up three decidedly crooked flights of stairs - was a little (all Venice rooms are little) cocoon of crimson and gold stripy fabric which covered every inch of walls and bedspread. The canal is a busy route for the gondoliers, who sing lustily and mainly quite well throughout the early evening, The staff at the Hotel desk are extremely welcoming and helpful, the hotel is clean, and the breakfast, though not an Englishman's idea of a breakfast, is is fresh and well presented in a light and airy room. Given the limitations of most small Venice hotels, that is; small rooms and no lifts or public rooms, this is about as good as they get.

Reviews.Title: “A central Venice hotel but small rooms and avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: melissaandmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Centauro Hotel and had a bit of a mixed stay. Advantages : - Very friendly and helpful staff - Really nice area of Venice and very easy to get to - Clean room and we had a small balcony (unfortunately not with a view, but it was nice to have a bit of space to sit outside) Disadvantages : - The breakfast made us both ill - me one day, my boyfriend the next day. We avoided it altogether on the 3rd day! - The room was tiny but we didn't really need any more space as we didn't spend much time there. If you can avoid the breakfast then this place is fine otherwise as a reasonably good value and friendly place to stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “What an oasis of calm in the middle of the city!!!”
Reviews.Author: susieshrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after reading the reviews posted on Trip Advisor - they were right - this hotel really is a hidden gem!! Finding it did prove a little difficult, but that could be said for most hotels in Venice, as none of them have gone down the lurid neon sign route, but if you follow the advice on here, and find the lion in Campo Manin, then you have found the best hotel in Venice!!! The location is perfect - it is a 3 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, and a 5 minute walk to Piazza San Marco, and it is situated on one of the small canals that criss-cross the city - you can stand on the balcony in the Breakfast Room and watch the world go by! The rooms are just beautiful, and cleaned to perfection. They are decorated in true venetian style, and are quiet, so you can get a fantastic night's sleep - perfect for all the walking you do when you are in Venice. The air-conditioning in the room was a god-send, as it was truly hot when we were there!! The staff are really helpful, and if they don't know the answer to your question, they will go and find someone who does! We travelled as a couple and we has the most fantastic break in this truly beautiful hotel - we are definitely goin back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: spiceygreeneyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, room was decent size, view at the canal, where we could see the gondolas passing, breakfast was decent, but hotel staff not great. Rooms were not cleaned until 3 pm next day, even later than 3 sometimes. No elevator, steps are really old, steep and covered with a smelly dusty carpet. No internet access. Overall we were not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: LusoCanuck
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time in Centauro. We traveled with an infant, and the hotel staff was accommodating. The location is amazing, a short walk to major sites of Rialto and S. Marco square, but within a quiet area. Venice isn't the most baby-friendly location (i.e. lack of elevators and ramps), but our only complaint about Centauro is the 16 euro / day charge for a crib. We brought our own camping crib instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: NeilOakshott
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. Excellent, friendly staff, simple but charming accommodation, nice breakfast, great location - right in the heart of the city - and very good value for money. We managed to get a family room (for 4 of us incl. 12 and 10 year old) and it overlooked a canal. Anyone travelling with kids knows how hard it is to get quad-rooms in Europe. Really great place run by people who obviously care!

Reviews.Title: “perfect style for venice”
Reviews.Author: wowlookatthat
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. staff were nice, room was just as I expected for venice, tiny shower. Triple room. excellent a/c, no mosquitos. Easy to find and easy to drag suitcases to from Rialto bridge stop. Great position. Beautiful balcony off breakfast room looking onto tiny canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: danadelmar
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much. the location was perfect and the front desk staff very helpful. We traveled with our 11 year old and 14 year old. The room had good air conditioning, was clean and a good size. The breakfast room was great. To find the hotel, when you get to the piazza, look for the only jewlry store which also sells masks. The alley to the right of the store is the one! Finding the hotel was part of the fun!

Reviews.Title: “Little classic room with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: momotarokawaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed the hotel for 2 nights and I found it was quite good value for the price. We were upgraded to Double room with private bathroom from shared bathroom. The room is tiny but nicely decorated with elegant furniture. Breakfast room is very nice, too. It was hard to find the hotel as it's on small street.... However, once you know where it is, it's convinient location. Only negative thing is the hotel is next to other building and no view from the window.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic setting in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyBoiii
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to book a room via booking.com. The Hotel is perfectly situated along a smaller side-canal from the grand canal. The easiest way to get there from the Marco Polo airport is to take the orange Vaporetto line and get off at the Rialto, if you know the way it takes about 45 seconds to get to the Centauro Hotel from the drop point. The hotel itself was very easy to find, we just went into the alley right next to the bank that is located next to the Manin statue. We lived on the top floor (third) and had no issues with either noise, bugs or heat/cold. The room had air conditioning and an electronic bug zapper (which we never needed). The TV is quite small and the only english speaking channel is CNN. From our room we could see the two bridges of campo Manin and the Rio TerÃ  degli Assassini street and from our windows we could also hear the somewhat cheezy singing of the gondoliers. From the hotel you have the Rialto, grand canal, San Marco's square, Accademia, Fenice and the Guggenheim very close by, it is in a sense the perfect location without being too crowded. The staff (which were made up of about 6 people during the 4 nights we stayed there) are all very friendly and helpful. Although when we asked about ATMs we were misunderstood and told that there were non to be found in all of Venice! (don't worry there are about 10 just around the corner). The map of Venice supplied by the staff is nothing I would recommend, it lacks all sorts of details and will get you lost in a hurry. It's preferable to buy a proper map of the city for a few Euros in one of the tourist stalls. The Hotel does not provide any internet or computer services, the only real drawback of the hotel together with not offering any room service. The majority of the guests seemed to be french and in older than 50 but there were the odd younger couple aswell, as a consequence the hotel is very quite, even during the morning breakfast rush hours. The breakfast was nice, you get yoghurt, a pick of different marmelades, butter, cheese, ham, rolls, croissants, grapefruit and orange juice, serial, fruit and so on and the breakfast staff will make you any coffee you'd like. Everything is clean and tastes great. The room itself was a little on the small side, but considering it's a 14th century building you'll manage. If you have trouble using stairs though, the Hotel is rendered useless (along with the rest of Venice for that matter) and getting to the third floor with 40 kg of luggage can be quite a challenge for someone who isn't fit. The hotel is also fitted with smoke detectors and escape routes located by your hotel door. Our room had a mini fridge and it's content was quite cheap for once. If you emptied it you wouldn't have spent much more than 10 Euros by my estimate. On the last day we stored our bags behind the clerks desk without any issues. All in all a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, enjoyed finding it!”
Reviews.Author: Pressman27473
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent time in Venice and the stay was made even more enjoyable by our stay at this hotel. After initially not being able to find the hotel we located it within 5 mins of standing close by! The welcome and staff we thought were excellent, little things such as knowing your room number and advising that you should be wearing your wellies made the experience great. Not having to pay for a safe was unusual too. We had room 3, which was handy being on the 1st floor, straight across from the breakfast area. We enjoyed the breakfast, but always found it amusing how many times people would leave 5 rolls etc on their table uneaten, a bit of a waste. Overall I would go again, a bit more fruit variety at breakfast would be my only minor drawback. The best sleep I have ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great... if you can find it”
Reviews.Author: wanderingchick
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 2 nights in the quadruple room of the Centauro Hotel. The hotel is tucked away on a side street, five minutes from the Rialto Bridge -- Unfortunately, it's so tucked away that it's nearly impossible to find! Con: No elevator, cramped room. Pros: Great Continental breakfast, friendly staff, centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: kjhUs
Reviews.Content: My mom and i stayed at this hotel 4 nights. The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The room was always clean and bigger than some of the european hotels weve stayed at. It is in a quiet area but only a 15 min walk to San Marco Square. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. And we will definitaley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean, tidy, friendly staff and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KentTim
Reviews.Content: As other recent reviews very good value for money and a great central location. We had no complaints and my wife and I will return to this hotel in the next few years. Breakfast is very good but don't expect anything hot - cerials, chesse, ham, jams, rolls, crossants, cakes etc. For location I would suggest getting a good map that has all the street names - we used WH Smiths Insight Venice flexi map - follow the hotel's directions - on reaching Calle delle Locande the hotel is around the first bend or get to Campo Manin, put the the two bridges going over the canel to your right and the hotel's sign can be seen at the end of the narrow street in front of you. Generally when using a resturant check the service charge (usual 12.5%) and whether a cover charge applies - can be Â£6 each - ouch!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute place in the very heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: mboy22
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers very good value for money. It's close to Rialto and St Mark (3-5 mins walking) and the water busses. The staff are helpful. Good breakfast in a pleasant hall.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: SafariMan149
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was built in 1904 (according to the floor mosaic) it seemed to have few draw backs. It is within 5 minutes of the Rialto Bridge and 15 minutes of St Marks. The rooms are clean and adequate with at least a shower and TV (with BBC World & CNN news). Breakfast were good & plentiful by budget Venice standards : tea, coffee, choice of cereals, yogurt, fruit, cheese, cold meats, croisants, rolls and jams etc. No other meals were available. Staff seemed to be multi-lingual, friendly, helpful and knowledgable. All walls seemed to be covered with fabric rather than wall paper. Two minor draw backs : - there is no lift - it has three floors, so it can be quite a climb with suitcases - it is down a number of narrow alleys and difficult to find - see directions in separate contribution.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jessicadmosley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at Centauro Hotel. The hotel had personality, well kept, and very clean. Breakfast was good! The only downfall was we had a very hard time finding the hotel when we arrived but after the first time we were able to locate the hotel easly.

Reviews.Title: “True Venetien experience”
Reviews.Author: cigalle
Reviews.Content: I was suprised by one of the previous reviews, where it was stated that Centauro is difficult to find. 1st - get lost in Venice is a necessary part of the scenario, 2nd - it is not true, if you keep in mind that hotel is situated in the same small side street as palazzo Contarini del Bovolo with its famous staircase. As soon as you find the sign with the inscription "palazzo Contarini del Bovolo", you'll see the Centauro hotel. I stayed in double en-suite and it was perfect: the size is OK, the furniture - in Venetian style, bath room very modern and clean. The position of the hotel is wonderful - you are in the heart of the city and at the same time the place is very quiet. I was particularly impressed by breakfast: not by the food itself (though good enough), but by the breakfast room with the windows looking at one of numerous canals, so every day I could hear true Venetian sounds - creaking of gondolas and yawning of gondoliers, which was absolutely charming!

Reviews.Title: “This is where "cute" really means "tiny"!”
Reviews.Author: Ladibug4u
Reviews.Content: We selected the "shared" bathroom, and what we got was an itsy bitsy bathroom down that hall that only our room used. And our room was a queen sized bed with 18" of floor on 3 sides. That being said, the room was charming, the staff was very kind and the breakfast was nice. I don't know if the private bathroom rooms are bigger, but since we didn't do anything but sleep in our room, it was perfect for us. Everyone talks about how hard this is to find, but we following the instructions given on the website and found it on the first try. I would most definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A true Venice Experience”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller_AU
Reviews.Content: When walking into our room I was blown away,... never stayed in a room like this before, The room was very nicely decked out in true Venecian style & had a canel view (which we requested). When we opened the windows we could hear people singing from the Gondola's...... it was definately a unqiue and enjoyable stay, The hotel is very central to the heart of Venice and easily accessable. Although fairly pricey we would definately recommend this hotel to others. We stayed 2 nights, however if you get good travel connections (eg. arrive noon day 1, fly out after dinner day 2 you could save some $$$ and still see most of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: LorraineConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I truly fell in love with Venice and the Centauro Hotel. My room was a single with bathroom. The bathroom was surprisingly quite up to date. Beautiful italian tile and spotlessly clean. The room was small as I had expected, it was perfect for a solo traveler. The staff was excellent and the breakfast room was inviting and quite satisfying (I even enjoyed the coffee). Lorraine from Connecticut

Reviews.Title: “Good for money”
Reviews.Author: corndog09
Reviews.Content: Located in Campo Mainn, this place is IMPOSSIBLE TO FIND. The hotel really needs to provide much better directions to find this place. Upon arrival, the desk clerk made it seem like we had no reservation (we had made one through their own website), which was slightly unnerving. Luckily, they had rooms. Location is nice, but it can still be tricky to find. Close to Rialto and San Marco. Good value. Breakfast wasn't the best, but it was free. View was of an alley. When checking in to our room, bed was unmade. Wifi is available, and very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, wonderful staff, clean too, but the coffee was awful”
Reviews.Author: tcyokohama
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights - and really found this to be a gem of a hotel. If you get a chance to stay in Venice for a few days I would really recommend this hotel The only negative point was the watery beverage, so-called American coffee, served in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Charming friendly peaceful hotel with opulent decor in superb location”
Reviews.Author: CamillaBristol
Reviews.Content: As a regular solo visitor to Venezia, for me this is the best in B&B hotels at a reasonable price. So easy to find, so friendly and welcoming; I didn't want to leave. Single room small, amazing decor but comfortable and superbly serviced on daily basis. I could mention the coffee but won't as the pleasure of staying at Centauro paled it into insignificance. Can't wait to go back some day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - great value for money”
Reviews.Author: phoenixblaze_x
Reviews.Content: Four of my friends and I decided to go to Venice for a cultural Hen weekend (nothing too rowdy) and we are so so glad that we booked the centauro. Yes the hotel is down a small dark alley so i can see why others may have found it slightly difficult to find but we had few difficulties. If you find Campo Manin (there is a big statue of a man and a winged lion) the alley is by the bank. When we arrived it was very late and the gentleman at the desk was very very welcoming and friendly, showed us our room and told us where to find a meal so late at night. Altogether i was very impressed by the service. He also sorted out the temerature in our room which was hot- by the time we had got back it was fine! The hotel itself is part of a old palace. The wallpapers and furnature are all very quaint and the bathroom was small but adequate. Perfect for a small break away for seeing the sights. I enjoyed the breakfast - bread, cheeses, croissants cereal and fruit. What more do you need? The location is amazing, a short amble in any direction will lead you to either St Marks, Accedemia Bridge or Rialto and although Venice is narrow and windey we had no trouble finding our way around. It was brilliant value for money 420 euro's for two rooms for five people over three days. Come here... ! If you want to see Venice and a happy without being surronded by utter luxury this is a fun, clean, friendly, quaint hotel. I would reccommend it a hundred times over.

Reviews.Title: “lackluster front desk, inadequate breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Epices6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Centauro Hotel because of its central location. My very small single room was very hot due to warm weather this October but no air-conditioning was available (turned off for the season, I guess). Opening the window brought so many mosquitoes I spent several miserable nights either sweating or being bitten. While most of the desk personnel was nice and accommodating, there was a guy working during the day who was not very helpful and I found his constant smirk to be enervating. The breakfast was really inadequate, terrible coffee and bread. I only ate there only the first morning even though breakfast was included in my room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money in Venice”
Reviews.Author: margopago
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: a TripAdvisor member from South Carolina, USA Mature couple We were at the Hotel Centauro Oct. 1st and 2nd pre cruise. The canal view room was very nice, clean and large enough by European standards. (you did have to stand by the window and look down to see the canal.) Breakfast was good and in a nice light and airy breakfast room. Location was great. (by the second day we could even find our way back to it!) Only negative was we were on the top floor. That was not bad as we considered it good exercise. The luggage is another matter. We travel light and only had one bag each but it would have been nice to have had help. We would stay there again as the price was by far the best we found at comparable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Venetian Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: louise_roumeliotis
Reviews.Content: After arriving in Venice via water taxi my husband and I consulted a very unhelpful map to find our way to Centauro. Needless to say, we did not have much luck finding the hotel. This was until a lovely local man, noticing the lost looks on our faces directed us to what can only be described as a very tucked away little lane where we were united with Hotel Centauro. If you are after a traditional venetian experience, then this is the hotel to go to. The room, while small was so full of character; our bed spread matched the vibrant wall-paper and our window looked out onto the canal where we could hear the passing gondolas drift by. The location was fantastic being only a stones throw from Piazza San Marco and the Rialto area. It was also extremely fun to wander aimlessly, exploring all the little tucked away lanes and cafes, getting lost in the process but inevitably always finding our way back to the hotel. As for food, the lovely girl on reception recommended "Rosa Rossa" and I have to say, this was the best meal we had in Europe. Cheap, traditional ventian cuisine with fantastic service and atmosphere. We loved it so much ended up back again the following night. Breakfast was plentiful with a variety from which to choose. Yes there are lots of stairs and no elevators but after enjoying the culinary delights that Venice has to offer, I was quite happy to use the stairs! I would stay at Centauro again without a shadow of doubt. Venice turned out to be one of the highlights of my honeymoon and this is largely due to the positive experience we had at hotel Centauro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTooTravel
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, travelling thru Italy, it was very difficult to find a hotel to accommodate us, but the Centauro did just that. The room was clean and had a decent size bathroom for Italy. The breakfast was very good. There wasn't much for views but just step out your door and the views are endless. I really liked the central location. We were able to walk to the Vaporetta (waterbus) in a couple minutes as well as many other sites. For our stay we paid $150 Euro per night which included breakfast and taxes. I did have to call the hotel to secure this price. Their website quotes a higher price for a quad room. I think the only downside to this hotel is when you first try to find it. It's down a very small alley-way and if you don't look way up you will miss their sign, which is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our family”
Reviews.Author: MikeandGayle
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a second floor 'quad' room at the Centauro Hotel. The hotel was comfortable, although smaller than quad rooms we had experienced in Rome and Florence. Bathroom, counter and closet space was at a premium, but beds were comfortable and room air conditioning worked well (a welcome improvement from previous hotels in Italy as it was very hot outside!). There were only a couple of minor problems: The shower had a leak, the tv remote didn't work (but we weren't there for t.v., anyway), and there's no elevator/lift, making carrying luggage quite a workout! We only stayed for 3 days (sufficient for a family with kids), but since the hotel was so centrally located, it was easy to see most of the tourist highlights around San Marco. Just be sure to invest in a good map as there a lot of small alleys leading to the main attractions, and those alleys are not always listed on cheaper maps. We did end up getting lost a couple of times, but that was fun, too!

Reviews.Title: “Good Good Good”
Reviews.Author: AshAndSal
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little Hotel down a narrow alley in Venice so it was nice and quiet. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The terrace we had was overlooked by the next room so we didn't use it. The stairs to the top (4th) floor took about a minute to get up due to the high ceilings and tired us out! But the room was nicley decorated and clean. The breakfast was self service and good quality, but its worthwhile getting there early as once the daily quota of food has been taken, its not replaced! IMPORTANT NOTE: The main door to the building has a fake door handle and is a push door which is quite heavy. When we first arrived no one was on reception through the glass door so rang the bell and tried the handle and gave it a little push (so not to seem brash or heavy handed). No answer to the bell and assumed the door was locked so carried bags around for next two hours in Venice heat! PUSH THE DOOR

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start but great stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_F_Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean, and tastefully decorated hotel within a 5-minute walk of Piazza San Marco and easy walking distance of the Accademia and Rialto bridge, among other famous Venetian sites. It was the perfect place from which to enjoy all that lovely Venice has to offer. The rooms were small (this is, after all, Europe) but had high (at least 10 feet-high) ceilings with exposed wooden beams -- a very nice touch. The attendants speak good English and were very helpful, both before and during our stay, with directions and restaurant reservations. We had a very pleasant stay. Unfortunately, check-in was a disaster. Although we had corresponded by e-mail and telephone after we made our reservation, they'd managed to lose our reservation by the time we arrived. Thank God (and Rick Steves) that I brought a print-out of the confirmation e-mail; otherwise, we might've ended up sleeping in Piazza San Marco! Seeing that we did indeed have a reservation, the agent scrambled to accommodate us. He said the hotel was full but they had a suite of rooms in another building where we could stay. This was worrisome because we had had a nightmarish ordeal in Rome several years ago that began this same way. With the assistance of an incredibly nice bellman, I lugged our stuff the few blocks to the other building. As promised, the rooms in the other building, though isolated from the hotel, were in fact nicer than the rooms in the hotel. Our check-in ordeal, however, was not yet over. Right as we began to unpack and my wife prepared to take a shower, there was a knock on our door: apparently, we were to stay in the hotel after all, not this building. Stunned, we gathered our belongings and made the trek back to the hotel, where we were taken upstairs to the room we had booked in the first place. Needless to say, this ordeal was not welcome after the long transatlantic flight. That said, once we were (finally) checked in, we had a great stay. The room was excellent, and the staff very helpful. I'm guessing this comedy of errors was atypical of this hotel, and it wasn't reflective of the high level of service we received before our arrival and after we were finally checked into our room. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel -- but, as always on international travel, reconfirm your reservation before arrival and bring proof of your reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience in Italy”
Reviews.Author: travelingchick42
Reviews.Content: What a charming facility! Although the entrance is down a small alley, which is common in Venice, we were pleasantly surprised by our accommodations. The hotel breakfast that was provided was exceptional. The dining area was quaint and the service was above average. We had a "side"view of the canal, but we were so tired from exploring that it really didn't matter. The hotel staff allowed us to leave our luggage so we could explore without the bags. The front desk was helpful and made us feel welcome. A truly worthwhile experience making Venice our favorite destination spot.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian style”
Reviews.Author: happywings
Reviews.Content: I scoured practically all the hotels in Venice and visited the majority of their websites looking for something nice in a mid-price range. I tend to judge a hotel by the standard of it's website and found this one to be very clear and had lots of good photos and a very good online booking system. I booked well in advance (Nov 06) to attend the Carnival in Feb 07. We chose a Double Superior room. When we arrived we were told there had been a problem with the plumbing and that they'd had to put us in a hotel nearby - assured by reception that the alternative hotel had rooms of the same standard. Unfortunately this was not the case at all, plus it was tucked away in some dull backstreets. I did not accept the alternative hotel, grumbled a bit to the management, and they put us in one of their best rooms in the end. Centauro calls itself a 3 star but I feel it is far beyond the standard of many other 3 star hotels (according to personal experience) and the rooms were furnished to a high standard. After this slight hiccup we had a wonderful time. The hotel staff were as helpful as possible (e.g. they let us know immediately a fax arrived for us which we'd been waiting for). The breakfast room was lovely with good buffet selection and friendly waitresses. Our room was quiet, large, comfy bed, posh bathroom, quite romantic actually - which is what one needs during carnival time. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: italy88
Reviews.Content: Very good location! 5 minute walk from the Rialto and 10 minutes to San Marco. Rooms are tiny (like most Italian rooms) and the "double" room really means two twin size beds. But we booked a room without a bathroom and when we got there, they gave us a room with a bathroom at no additional cost. Breakfast is included everyday and it was perfect. Great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: Scraps01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Centauro for three nights and were rudely woken up at 6.30am to 7.00am each morning. Turns out the laundry was strategically placed directly above our room and this was the best time for the laundry lady to wash, iron, fold, and test her heavy high-heeled shoes on the stone floor above. Three mornings of complaints earned us three frustrating styles of indifference ranging from "I will see what I can do" to "There is nothing I can do" to a simple shrugging of the shoulders with palms faced forward in an open-handed salute. They were completely rude to us and added insult to injury by offering to move us to another room at our cost. We declined. In addition to the horrors of the laundry, we eventually found our bathroom inconveniently positioned some 25 metres or so up a hall that passed another dozen-or-so rooms. We met most of the other guests in the hotel clad in nothing but a towel and clutching our toiletries. The room was small and bunker-like. Hotels are notoriously difficult to find in Venice however Hotel Centauro is easily located by finding the darkest most narrow back-alley adorned with scaffolding. Venice itself is beautiful and the people friendly. We found the rudeness of our hoteliers an anomaly. We travelled through Europe for nearly three months over July, August and September and stayed in literally dozens of hotels. Out of all of them, we easily rated this our worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace for a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pearl1969
Reviews.Content: We arrived here for a three day break. the room we were given 33 was a pityful excuse for a room; exceptionally small tiny bathroom no storage dated furniture and filthy. Asked for glasses and ice to be told only plastic glasses available in room and no ice could be provived!!! Also asked 3 times for extra pillows and had to go to reception and pick them up myself. Staff rude unwelcoming and bad attitude i do not recommend anyone stays there. A truely horrible experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: JJJSBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Venice, so we tried to have a low expectation so that we were not dissapointed. Don't let a rating of three stars put you off this hotel, as the rooms were fantastic and the hostpitality was excellent. We had a large group and we were spread across four rooms for two nights. Only one of the rooms had canal views, but lets face it, unless you are spending weeks in Venice, you are not about to sit in your room for any length of time with so much outside to see. Mariano at reception was very patient with us considering we didn't know more than 5 words of Italian, and the breakfast was all you need to start the day. Considering we had just sampled hotels and B&B's throughout France, Switzerland and Austria prior to this, we were pleasantly surprised and we highly recommend the Hotel Centauro for 1 - 5 night stays. If you wish to stay longer I would recommend getting a canal view room so that you have an outlook for when you wish to relax in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel79
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 2 years ago, but as its in Venice, i think its very difficult to make big changes in the building... So where do i start? Beware of the photos, bedrooms are not like these photos, i dont know where they took them!!! We got a bedroom on the 2nd floor, there is no elevator... But the worst is arriving in venice at 10 pm, getting the vaporetto to St Marcos square, and no one knows where this hotel is!!! Fortunetely, the gondola men helped us, and we finally got there. The hotel is a dark alley, with no way out. Once you get to the bedroom, you open the window and voilÃ¡! A brick wall right in front (2 mts...) The walls in the bedroom are dirty with dead mosquitoes iarck!!! The bathroom is veeeery small, but at least its clean. The best part of staying here was the good breakfast, in a beautiful living room, looking right in to a canal. In fact, there is a canal right near the hotel, i recommend going for a ride in the gondola, its expensive but its a unique experience. As for the hotel, there are many others in the area, i dont know what they look like inside, but i wouldnt stay here again and wouldnt recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “What a centauro of a little charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: ESilver
Reviews.Content: This charmingly decorated three-star hotel was really a jewel of a Hotel in Venice. Everything about the hotel was charming: the hidden-kind of-location, the turn of the century venetian decor, the cleanliness, the service, the great breakfast buffet, but furthermore, the great view of the gondoliers, from my two -big windows - overlooking the canal, made this trip to Venezia an unforgetable treasure to my memory and senses for a long time to come. Eva from Culver City, California

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location!”
Reviews.Author: angiejkirkland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hotel Centauro. Great location, average accomodations. The room was small, but not unusually so. Everything was very clean and the decor was nice (typical Venetian.) The shower was very small - it can be quite the wet adventure if you drop your shampoo or soap! The staff was helpful and recommended some good restaurants. The location in Campo Manin is great. Only a 5-minute walk to St. Mark's square. Our room was on the 3rd floor on the canal side. View of the canal, if you lean out the window! It was fun to hear the gondoliers singing into the evening. Watch leaving your windows open too late as the mosquitoes will come in and eat you up!

Reviews.Title: “Gondelierssinging”
Reviews.Author: chinagirlAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Centauro is in the middle of Venice, so a lot of popular places are just a few minutes walking, like the S. Marcoplace. Only a few rooms with canalview, as well as the breakfastroom, but you'll hear the singing and music of the passing gondels from early the morning till late in the evening. Very charming. Very friendly staff, very good breakfast in a big breakfastroom and the rooms elegantly in Venetian style, with some modern accents. Everything tip-top. Very good prices for single room without bathroom. A good place to stay for discovering the charm of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “dont go there, find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: irish257
Reviews.Content: worst hotel i ever stayed in, the second nite we returned to our room we found someone had been in our room and had gone thru our stuff, the room was tiny and the shared toilet\shower was was smaller than an closet, we were also badly biten by mosquitos, i would recommend not staying there

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed, website is pretty, rooms were not”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Sid
Reviews.Content: We booked a Double Superior room with a panaromic terrace view. We arrived to find a cramped and small room with no view. The only way to get the view shown on the hotel's website would have been to use a ladder to climb on the roof. To further complicate things, the management had a "not my problem" attitude. After 2 hours of fruitlessly discussing various options, which included paying more for an even smaller room, we left to find another hotel. Returning home to find our credit card had been charged for a room that did not exist, was icing on the cake of a really bad experience. Nitpicks: The website was written by a very creative writer, and the photos were photoshop'ed by an expert. We couldnt even find the angle at which the front of the hotel was taken.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Liberty63
Reviews.Content: I booked my hotel with Venere.com It was close to Rialto being in Campo Manin. I stayed in room 4 but the problem with this room is that it is right next to the breakfast room. At 6.00 am every morning I was awoken by the noise of clanging dishes. The hotel room was dark and the window opened to a concrete contained area, no views. The refrigerator did not work. I complained but still it was not fixed. The phone worked and you can use a calling card. It was clean but you needed to turn on the light in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Returned, enjoyed and look forward to next time!”
Reviews.Author: LouMG
Reviews.Content: First visit to the Centauro was 3 years ago, returning summer 2005 and again this October. Once you find somewhere that's ideally situated, clean, with character and decent breakfast why take the risk of trying somewhere new? This hotel usually has deals in August- presumably due to heat but going in October found room more expensive but comparable with other hotels in Venice. Wouldn't recommend hotel to those unable to climb stairs (with luggage) otherwise nothing negative to write. Staff efficient, rooms clean and with Venetian feel due to furniture etc. OK only a few have few of canal but after a wonderful day's sightseeing and carafe of the old vino rosso who cares? Would highly recommend the Restaurant Rosa Rossa, over the little brige from hotel square, along on left hand side. Good value, venetian food and wine, with friendly staff (especially once they recognise you from night before) Closed Tuesday night. P.S. Ensure no mosquito has secretly entered your room and is planning a midnight attack!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngieInItaly
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, 5 minutes walk from St. Mark's and view of canaletto with gondoliers. Contact the hotel directly for good rates. A phone call might get the best results, but email is good too. Hotel Centauro saved our trip to Venice! Unwittingly, we booked a room at a "hotel" that was really guest rooms in someone's house. The owner had taken in a family of 4 w/o reservation before we arrived and gave them our 3 person room since they were a 4 person family. We were not happy being mushed into a tiny 1 person room with 3 twin beds and no room to walk - we had to stash our luggage under the beds! This hotel was just around the corner and had a room available. Andrea was very friendly and gave us the same rate we were paying at this other person's guest room w/o breakfast. Sadly, Andrea was the only nice and helpful staff we encountered. I can only give the hotel 4 stars because of his unfriendly co-workers who seemed suspicious of us, possibly because we were Americans who arrived with no reservation. Most of the hotel's clients seemed to be European families. While it is true there is no elevator/lift, it is probably because the Centauro is located in a historic building in Venice and obtaining a building permit for them would be a nightmare. If you are fit enough to bring your luggage all the way from the train station and again from the main canal through the Venetian calles to the hotel, than you can probably manage carrying the lugguge up the stairs and through the halls (it is not a big hotel). The hotel itself is just as it appears on their website - small and elegant with marbled floors, stairs, and counters. The breakfast room was welcoming with a beautiful view of the canaletto the hotel is on. Beverage service is provided (they even will make cafe americano if you ask) and we found a nice selection of cereals, croissants, yogurt, meats and cheeses, some fruit, and even hard boiled eggs. We had to change rooms once during our stay because we came without reservations. Our first room had a marvelous view of the canal with passing gondoliers en canto, the second had a view of a fine Venetian wall complete with pigeon staring at us. The benefit of the second room is the absence of gondolier singing in the evening as you try to go to sleep. The rooms were both nicely decorated in Venetian style with a chandelier to make you feel elegant in your surroundings. The bathrooms were modern and very clean. A warning: while on the second floor we opened the window to enjoy the sounds of passing gondoliers in the early evening and a mosquito got in the room. The rest of the night we kept waking up from it buzzing in our ears, but we could not find the darn thing. We liked the hotel enought that I booked my family there on a visit to Venice the next summer and we had no complaints except that the staff is not very friendly. also, thier friends called the hotel directly and were able to get a suite with canal view for less than my aunt's double room which was suppose to have a view of the canal, but did not have a full view.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: portos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel at the end of June 2006. Our room was on the second floor (third level). The absence of the lift was a bit irritating, since the stairs are steep. On the bright sight the location of the hotel is excellent, staff is very helpful, and it is very reasonably priced. The room and the bathroom were very clean, breakfast was good as well. Make sure you come to the breakfast room earlier rather than later, since the choice of food reduces with time.

HotelInfo.Name: Centauro Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: S.Marco, Campo Daniele Manin, 4297/A, 30124 Venice, Italy
